StartFragment

API workaround

Case 01580253 - Demo  
Support: Inside DEVICES in BHOM. it shows there are active events, but those  
events dont appear at the bottom, in the list view  
  
This is a match on defects DRTOM-19962/DRTOM-22362 which are not resolved yet.  
  
There is a workaround to execute the following API:  
[https:///tsws/monitoring/api/v1.0/device/resetDeviceTileCounts](https://<TENANT_URL>/tsws/monitoring/api/v1.0/device/resetDeviceTileCounts)  
  
Method : POST  
Headers:  
Content-Type: application/json  
Authorization: Bearer  
Body :  
{"ciName": ""}  

Note: Replace and details with actual  
values before execution.  
  
Example device names:  
clm-pun-t35219.bmc.com  
clm-pun-uftxv3.bmc.com

request.description: To add 3rd party metrics to services as Health Indicators you'll need to add a "associatedElements" block (see saved examples) such as the one below: `"associatedElements": [ { "type": "health_processing", "elements": [ { "selectors": [], "scoreMapping": {}, "statusMapping": {}, "propagation": "enabled", "element_type": "health_processing" } ] }, { "type": "metric_group", "label": "tempId#1", "elements": [ { "selectors": [ { "value": { "entityId": "AppDynamics:`[346862526@login.aspx](https://)`:AppDynamics_Business_Transaction_Performance:Business_Transactions", "entityTypeId": "AppDynamics_Business_Transaction_Performance", "node_kind": "Server", "source": "AppDynamics", "metric": "95th_Percentile_Response_Time__ms_" }, "selector_type": "metric_entity_ade" } ], "element_type": "metrics_kpi" }, { "selectors": [], "element_type": "metrics_supporting" } ], "configurations": [] } ],` **To get the values to fill the associatedElements fields do the following:** Look for the "device" with the desired metric through the BHOM UI Make note of the "type" value as it will be used for node_kind Next, Drill down to the desired metric. Stop just before clicking to load the graphic of JUST the desired metric Make note of the first part of the agent name as it will be the "source" (e.g. AppDynamics") Open the browser developer tools e go to the network tab: Then click "apply" to load the graph. In the developer tools click on the "POST" request that was made and then open its request tab Use attributeId for "metric" Use moTypeId for "entityTypeId" Use monitorId for "entityId" Note that you may need to decode "%xx" codes that show up in the ids above to their corresponding ASCII. Common ones include "%40" that needs to be changed to "@" and "%3A" to ":" Using these values, you can add the metric and save the updated service. If all was done correctly, the new metric can be seen through the UI. Click action->edit to check if the "create alarm policy" is enabled. If not, HSM failed to find the metric and associated CI/Entity. An example of a successfully working 3rd party health metric: _**Note that HSM simply doesn't show any metrics that it doesn't locate successfully, meaning that it doesn't penalize miss-configurations**_

To add 3rd party metrics to services as Health Indicators you'll need to add a "associatedElements" block (see saved examples) such as the one below: `"associatedElements": [ { "type": "health_processing", "elements": [ { "selectors": [], "scoreMapping": {}, "statusMapping": {}, "propagation": "enabled", "element_type": "health_processing" } ] }, { "type": "metric_group", "label": "tempId#1", "elements": [ { "selectors": [ { "value": { "entityId": "AppDynamics:`[346862526@login.aspx](https://)`:AppDynamics_Business_Transaction_Performance:Business_Transactions", "entityTypeId": "AppDynamics_Business_Transaction_Performance", "node_kind": "Server", "source": "AppDynamics", "metric": "95th_Percentile_Response_Time__ms_" }, "selector_type": "metric_entity_ade" } ], "element_type": "metrics_kpi" }, { "selectors": [], "element_type": "metrics_supporting" } ], "configurations": [] } ],` **To get the values to fill the associatedElements fields do the following:** Look for the "device" with the desired metric through the BHOM UI Make note of the "type" value as it will be used for node_kind Next, Drill down to the desired metric. Stop just before clicking to load the graphic of JUST the desired metric Make note of the first part of the agent name as it will be the "source" (e.g. AppDynamics") Open the browser developer tools e go to the network tab: Then click "apply" to load the graph. In the developer tools click on the "POST" request that was made and then open its request tab Use attributeId for "metric" Use moTypeId for "entityTypeId" Use monitorId for "entityId" Note that you may need to decode "%xx" codes that show up in the ids above to their corresponding ASCII. Common ones include "%40" that needs to be changed to "@" and "%3A" to ":" Using these values, you can add the metric and save the updated service. If all was done correctly, the new metric can be seen through the UI. Click action->edit to check if the "create alarm policy" is enabled. If not, HSM failed to find the metric and associated CI/Entity. An example of a successfully working 3rd party health metric: _**Note that HSM simply doesn't show any metrics that it doesn't locate successfully, meaning that it doesn't penalize miss-configurations**_

request.description:
## Cria requisies a partir do template ID de um Fluxo.

____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

##### Descrio:

Cria um registro no formulrio SRM:RequestInterface_Create com campos bsicos necessrios para a criao de uma Requisio no formulrio SRM:Request bem como seus filhos "Work Orders e/ou Incidents".

____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

##### Pontos de Ateno:
* No  possvel abrir uma REQ cujo processo do template possui rvore de deciso, se isto for necessrio ser obrigatria a criao de um fluxo para cada condicional.
* No  possvel preencher campos de Perguntas e Respostas de fluxos via API na verso 9.1.

____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

##### BODY:

* Z1D Action: Indica a ao  ser Realizada, geralmente "MODIFY" ou "CREATE".

* Source Keyword: Indica a origem da solicitao, auxiliando na identificao da origem, insira "Integrao + Nome do Seu Sistema".

* TitleInstanceID:  o Instance ID do fluxo  ser utilizado, para entendimento da ferramenta de qual processo seguir.

* Status:  o status desejado da requisio, por default o valor  "Submitted" pois  o status que dar incio  transao.

* Company: Indica a empresa que est solicitando a requisio, por default  "B3".

____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

##### HEADERS:

* Authorization:  o token para acessar a ferramenta, obtido atravz da chamada POST Request Token, sempre necessrio o prefixo AR-JWT(espao)+TOKEN.

* Content-Type: Deve indicar o modelo de dados que est sendo enviado, por ser REST e em geral linha de cdigo, o valor default  "application/json".

## Cria perguntas e respostas para requisies a partir de IDs de Templates e Requisies.

____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

##### Descrio:

Cria um registro no formulrio SRD:MultipleQuestionResponse.

____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

##### Pontos de Ateno:

*  necessrio o alinhamento com a equipe de Gesto de Remedy & SRM p/ o incio da utilizao de novas perguntas de fluxos via API, pois os campos QuestionDef_InstanceID e QuestionSRD_Instance ID devem possuir os valores adequados, caso contrrio poder causar erros na requisio.
* Cada pergunta de cada fluxo tem os seus valores dos campos QuestionDef_InstanceID e QuestionSRD_Instance ID exclusivos.

____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

##### BODY:

* QuestionDef_InstanceID: ID identificador da questo que est em utilizao.

* QuestionSRD_Instance ID: ID identificador do relacionamento da questo ao fluxo.

* Question Text: Texto da questo (questionamento).

* Answer In Char: Valor da resposta da questo.

* Answer Internal: Valor da resposta da questo.

* Menu Label: Valor da resposta da questo.

* SRInstanceID: Instance Id da requisio.

* Commit Status: Por default  "Yes", indica o objetivo de inserir a questo no banco de dados.

* AnswerFormat: Geralmente  "STATIC_MENU" ou "TEXT", indica o tipo da resposta inserida.

____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

##### HEADERS:

* Authorization:  o token para acessar a ferramenta, obtido atravz da chamada POST Request Token, sempre necessrio o prefixo AR-JWT(espao)+TOKEN.

* Content-Type: Deve indicar o modelo de dados que est sendo enviado, por ser REST e em geral linha de cdigo, o valor default  "application/json".
Create an entry in SRM:WorkInfo form.

request.description:
It deletes 2500 in a single batch with 5 minutes sleep in between the runs.  
This will mark the Running in failed first and then delete them.

To define the timestamp values, you can use a site such as [https://epochtimestamp.com/](https://epochtimestamp.com/)

    "id": "3780660e-24f5-4428-9c86-68ba741b82a2",

    "updated_by": "activationuser",

    "execution_order": 1,
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Extract Event Information",
            "type": "EXTRACTION",
            "details": {
                "logField": "message",
                "regex": "Evento:(?<EventID>[0-9]+)\\s+Disp:(?<EventDisp>[0-9]+)\\s+Erro:(?<EventError>[0-9]+)\\s+Tipo:(?<EventCode>[A-Za-z0-9]+)\\s+Dt/hora 1a ocorr:(?<EventFirstOccurrence>[0-9\\/\\-:]+)",
                "sampleInput": "Ocorrencia: IMPRESSORA RECIBOS Sem papel - Evento:517 Disp:1 Erro:4 Tipo:CONSUMIVEL  Dt/hora 1a ocorr:10/10/2023-12:44:48",

                ]
            },
